dean.position: Dean of Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law IAIN Bone
dean.quote: We are very pleased to present this website as a medium of information and communication for the academic community, students, the public, and our partners. Through this portal, we hope to showcase various study programs, academic activities, and student activities.
dean.description: Our faculty is committed to providing quality higher education, innovative research, and beneficial community service. Through this website, we hope to provide a complete picture of our vision, mission, study programs, academic activities, and various achievements we have made. We invite all members of the academic community to actively participate in every activity we organize. Let us work together to realize the vision and mission of the Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law to create an innovative and moderate academic environment.

historyContent.p1: The State Islamic Institute (IAIN) Bone is the only State Islamic Religious Higher Education Institution in Bone Regency, located in the capital city of Watampone. The existence of IAIN Bone began with the establishment of Universitas Islam Raya Bone in 1964.
historyContent.p2: In 1967, it changed status to become the Faculty of Sharia of the State Islamic Institute (IAIN) Alauddin Ujung Pandang in Watampone as a Branch Class based on Rector's Decree No. 14 of 1967. Then in 1968, it changed to the Faculty of Sharia Branch of IAIN Alauddin Ujung Pandang, specializing in Bachelor's degree programs.
historyContent.p3: Based on the Decree of the Minister of Religion of the Republic of Indonesia No. 56 of 1982, it changed status to become the Middle Faculty Branch of Alauddin Ujung Pandang, specializing in Master's degree programs. In 1997, the Faculty of Sharia Branch of IAIN Alauddin Ujung Pandang institutionally changed to the State Islamic College (STAIN) Watampone based on Presidential Decree No. 11 of 1997.
historyContent.p4: Based on Presidential Regulation No. 23 of 2018, STAIN Watampone transformed into the State Islamic Institute Bone. This institutional change is an effort to empower and enlighten higher education institutions, especially Islamic Higher Education as an anticipation of demands and changes in the global environment.
historyContent.p5: In 2005, the Faculty of Sharia changed to the Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law, overseeing three study programs: Islamic Family Law (Ahwal Syakhshiyyah), Constitutional Law (Siyasah Syar'iyyah), and Sharia Economics.

timeline.1964: Establishment of Universitas Islam Raya Bone
timeline.1967: Faculty of Sharia IAIN Alauddin Makassar in Bone
timeline.1968: Faculty of Sharia Branch IAIN Alauddin Makassar, Bachelor's program
timeline.2005: Faculty of Sharia becomes Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law with 3 study programs

historyContent.p1: The Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law IAIN Bone is one of the oldest faculties in the IAIN Bone environment. Established in 1964, this faculty has made a significant contribution to the development of Islamic law education in Indonesia, especially in the Eastern Indonesia region.
historyContent.p2: At the beginning of its establishment, this faculty only had one study program, namely the Islamic Law Study Program. Along with the times and the needs of the community, this faculty continues to develop and add new study programs.
historyContent.p3: In 1980, this faculty opened the Constitutional Law Study Program which focuses on the study of constitutional law from an Islamic perspective. Then in 1995, the Sharia Economic Law Study Program was opened which aims to produce graduates who are experts in the field of sharia economic law.
historyContent.p4: Not stopping there, in 2005, this faculty again opened the Islamic Family Law Study Program which focuses on the study of family law in Islam. Thus, currently the Faculty of Sharia and Islamic Law IAIN Bone has four study programs, all of which have been accredited A by BAN-PT.
historyContent.p5: For more than 50 years of existence, this faculty has graduated thousands of scholars spread throughout Indonesia. Alumni have contributed a lot in various sectors, both in government, private, and community.
